intro: Rhynchelythrum dregeanum var. annuum, commonly known as the annual rhynchelythrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. This variant is distinguished by its annual life cycle, which contrasts with the perennial form of the species.
